title: Vector Representation
text: Since the function has an input that is denoted as three dimensional from the $$R^3$$, it means that the $$x$$ vector has three components that all must be accounted for in the function.

title: Distance
text: To find the distance between two vectors, subtract the corresponding components and square their difference. Then, take the square root of the sum of all the squared component differences.

title: Function Variables
text: The function will be written in terms of the components of $$x$$ (x_1, $$x_2$$, and x_3), which are kept as variables. Treat the components of $$x$$ as if they were numerals.

title: Value of Origin
text: The vector value of the origin is a vector with components that are all zero.

title: Vector of the Origin
text: What is the vector representation of the origin in $$R^3$$?

title: Square of the Distance
text: Make sure that the final answer is the calculated distance from the distance formula squared.
